Episodes.Title: Pilot
Episodes.Plot: After missing and presumed dead for eight years, Marine Sergeant Nicholas Brody is rescued in Iraq, and returns home to his family. But CIA agent Carrie Mathison suspects he might have been turned by his terrorist captors, and believes he could be part of a plan to attack America.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: R16 Violence,offensive language and sex scenes
Episodes.Writer: Howard Gordon, Alex Gansa, Gideon Raff
Episodes.GuestStars: Jamey Sheridan, Navid Negahban, David Marciano, Maury Sterling, Nestor Serrano, Afton Williamson, Israel Balderas

Episodes.Title: Grace
Episodes.Plot: Carrie continues to surveil Brody but is unable to follow his actions into his garage which is a blind spot, where Brody begins to perform an Islamic prayer. Meanwhile, Carrie receives visual confirmation from an undercover agent that shows Al-Qaeda member Abu Nazir on video meeting with the Royal Prince of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: R16 Violence,offensive language and sex scenes
Episodes.GuestStars: Michael McKean, David Marciano, Maury Sterling, Navid Negahban, Amy Hargreaves, Scott Bryce, Amir Arison, Brianna Brown

Episodes.Title: Clean Skin
Episodes.Plot: Brody prepares to enter the spotlight; Carrie closes in on an al-Qaeda plot.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: R16 Violence,offensive language and sex scenes
Episodes.GuestStars: David Marciano, Maury Sterling, Navid Negahban, Lawrence O'Donnell, Amir Arison, Alok Tewari, Omid Abtahi

Episodes.Title: Semper I
Episodes.Plot: The political powers that be make big plans for national hero Brody, but his increasingly erratic behavior threatens his media darling status; Carrie grows desperate for evidence linking Brody with Abu Nazir, as Saul directs her to focus on Nazir's money trail.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: R16 Violence,sexual references and offensive language
Episodes.GuestStars: David Marciano, Maury Sterling, Navid Negahban, Scott Bryce, Omid Abtahi, Marin Ireland, Hrach Titizian

Episodes.Title: Blind Spot
Episodes.Plot: Brody confronts the lone survivor among the insurgents that held him, leading Carrie to believe she may be proved right about Brody once and for all - but Brody's reunion with his captor surprises everyone; the agency is hot on the trail of the lovers who bought a house near the airport with funds from a stolen necklace.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: R16 Violence,sexual references and offensive language
Episodes.GuestStars: David Marciano, Maury Sterling, Navid Negahban, Amy Hargreaves, James Rebhorn, Waleed Zuaiter, Hrach Titizian

Episodes.Title: The Good Soldier
Episodes.Plot: Reeling after losing key players in Nazir's plot against America, the CIA orders polygraphs on everyone who came in contact with them, including Brody, which Carrie sees as an opportunity to finally learn the truth.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: R16 Violence,sexual references and offensive language
Episodes.GuestStars: Hrach Titizian, Omid Abtahi, Marin Ireland, Sarita Choudhury, James Urbaniak, Sherman Howard, Afton Williamson

Episodes.Title: The Weekend
Episodes.Plot: The relationship between Carrie and Brody becomes more complicated when they head into the countryside for the weekend, while Mike and Jessica face the fallout of the truth about their relationship, and Saul catches Aileen on the run to Mexico.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: R16 Violence,sexual references and offensive language
Episodes.GuestStars: Amy Hargreaves, Hrach Titizian, Marin Ireland, Joe Ward, Bridget Gethins, Taylor Kowalski, Chelsea Cardwell

Episodes.Title: Achilles Heel
Episodes.Plot: As Carrie and Saul reel from the news that Walker is alive, the intelligence community clashes on the best way to capture him; Brody learns a shocking truth about his captivity.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: R16 Violence,sexual references and offensive language
Episodes.GuestStars: Linda Purl, Sarita Choudhury, Joe Urla, Sammy Sheik, Afton Williamson, Chris Chalk, Hrach Titizian

Episodes.Title: Crossfire
Episodes.Plot: After his attempt to sever ties with Abu Nazir, Brody finds himself reliving his captivity and recommits to his mission; Carrie finds herself in the middle of a public relations nightmare on the heels of the mosque shooting.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: R16 Violence,sexual references and offensive language
Episodes.GuestStars: Chris Chalk, Hrach Titizian, Jamey Sheridan, Navid Negahban, Rohan Chand, Ramsey Faragallah, Billy Smith

Episodes.Title: Representative Brody
Episodes.Plot: Carrie and Saul identify Walker's contact in Washington but their target has diplomatic immunity; Brody is approached to run for a disgraced congressman's seat in the House of Representatives.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: R16 Violence,sexual references and offensive language
Episodes.GuestStars: David Marciano, Chris Chalk, Ramsey Faragallah, Chris Chalk, Trent Dawson, Remy Auberjonois, Gabe Begneaud

Episodes.Title: The Vest
Episodes.Plot: In the wake of the explosion, Saul finds Carrie hospitalized and manic, but realizes her chaotic theories have merit; before his congressional campaign begins, Brody takes his family on a weekend trip to Gettysburg, where he retrieves an important item.
Episodes.GuestStars: Jamey Sheridan, Hrach Titizian, James Rebhorn, Nasser Faris, Charles Borland, Benjamin Pelteson

Episodes.Title: Marine One
Episodes.Plot: While Carrie is near catatonic and confined to bed, Saul investigates the unsettling implications of her timeline; Walker secures a perch for his mission; Brody makes his final preparations for the Vice President's policy summit at the State Department.
Episodes.GuestStars: Linda Purl, David Marciano, Jamey Sheridan, Amy Hargreaves, Hrach Titizian, Chris Chalk, Navid Negahban
